Practice It Right-Let’s Be Polite # 455

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Practice It Right-Let's Be Polite Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", 3am, Again, Dialed, Dumber, Entertainment, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Number, Over, Poetry, Practice It Right-Let's Be Polite, Rhyme, Wrong

Yes, you dialed the wrong number-

But, three times, at 3am, begins to feel dumber and dumber.

-2010-

A Quick Say-In A Rhyming Way # 540

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in A Quick Say-In My Own Way Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", A Quick Say-In My Own Way, Entertainment, Good, Health, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Poetry, Rhyme, Wealth, Worship

It is good for one’s health-
To worship those with wealth.

-2013-

Three Places To Find Other Oil Spills (2010)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2010 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Chicago, Cleanup, Entertainment, Find, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Michigan, NY, Oil, Orders, Other, Places, Poetry, Rhyme, Small, Southern, Spills, Tall

1. Outside Chicago.
2. Southern Michigan.
3. New York.

=========================

Small-

With cleanup orders that are tall.

Three Movements (2013)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2013 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Dry, Entertainment, Full Force, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Movements, Poetry, Rhyme, Scattered showers, Skipped, Texas, Thundershowers, Weather, Wet

1. School buses rolling.

2. East Texas quake.

3. Thunderstorms across the general area.

================================

Scattered, of course-

Meaning one area may be skipped,

while another will feel the rain, full force.

Three Places You Might Suspect To See A Body Scanner (2013)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2013 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Airport, Doctor office, Driver's license, Entertainment, Fraud, History, It is you, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Poetry, Rhyme, Scan, Voting, Voting location, What?

1. At the airport.

2. In the doctor’s office.

3. At your nearest voting location.

===================================

The way that they scanned over my “first

time used” driver’s license-

I figured that there might be more, to

add to the suspense.

Three To Fight At The Game (2013)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2013 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Alabama, Brawl, Coaches, Entertainment, Fight, Football game, High School, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Players, Poetry, Rhyme, Spectators, Sportsmanship

1. Players.

2. Spectators.

3. Coaches.

==================

A no stall-

For the Alabama high school brawl.

Three To Swim (2013)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2013 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", 100 miles, Cuba, Diana Nyad, Entertainment, Florida, History, Laps, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Poetry, Rhyme, Sensation, Swim, Swimmer

1. One Lap.

2. Ten laps.

3. 100 miles.

=

For Diana Nyad a

congratulation-

For you are one sensation.

The Highlight Of The Day-In My Own Way # 521

The one who created Beetle Bailey-

Cartoonist Mort Walker turning ninety.

-2013_

Three Things That Men Do Not Fear (2010)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2010 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Body care, Body cream and lotions, Entertainment, Everyone, Fear, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Men, Mice, Poetry, Rhyme, Spiders

1. Spiders.

2. Mice.

3. Face and body creams.
========================
For in the end-
We all like to take care of our
skin, over and over again.

Three Places To Wait (2009)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2009 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Doctor office, Entertainment, Grocery line, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Patience, Poetry, Purchase, Rhyme, Tarmac, Ticket, Transportation, Wait

1. At the doctors office.

2. In the grocery line.

3. On the tarmac.
=========================
Extra waiting time is what one seems
to get-
When they purchase that airline
ticket.

Three Ways To Know That Your Memory Is Not As Good As It Used To Be (2008)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2008 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Budget, Entertainment, Forgot, History, Important dates, Loss, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Memory, Phone numbers, Poetry, Rhyme, Twenty dollar bill

1. You tend to have a hard time remembering phone numbers.

2. You sometimes forget important dates.

3. You forget about that twenty dollar bill you had in your purse.
===================================================
One thing you thought you’d never forget-
Especially if you’ve always been a tight budget.

Three Things That Politicians Raise (2006)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2006 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Awareness, Campaign, Campaign donations, Entertainment, Eyebrows, Funds, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Poetry, Politicians, Politics, raise, Rhyme

1. Campaign funds.
2. Awareness.
3. Eyebrows.
=================================
Especially when favors are dated-
Shortly after the money has been donated!

THREE REASONS TO WAIT ON A TRAIN (2005)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2005 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Bigger than you, Entertainment, History, Life, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Patience, Poetry, Rhyme, Train, Train track, Wait on train

1. You’re not really in a hurry.
2. Wherever you are going is not that important.
3. The train is bigger than you.
=====================
PATIENCE IS A VIRTUE AS THEY SAY-
AND IN THIS CASE IF YOU DON’T HAVE IT,
WELL YOU MAY BE LOOKING AT YOUR LAST  DAY!

THREE KNOWN FACTS ABOUT POLITICIANS (2004)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2004 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Benefit, Contributions, Elections, Entertainment, History, Influence, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Poetry, Politicians, Represent, Rhyme, Run

THREE KNOWN FACTS ABOUT POLITICIANS:
  1. They are always well qualified.
  2. They run to benefit the people.
  3. The contributions that they receive never influence their  decisions.
======================================
AND AS WE “DELAY” THAT THOUGHT-
THE REST OF THE FAIRY TALES
WILL BE SOUGHT!

THREE REASONS YOU SHOULD NOT SPEED ON THE FREEWAY (2003)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2003 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Control, Entertainment, Freeway, Happenings, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Poetry, Rhyme, Speed, Suddenly, Transportation

1. It’s against the law.

2  You cannot handle your car as well in
case something suddenly happens.

3. You cannot predict what is going on with
the cars or the folks driving ahead of you
that could cause an accident..
——————————————
Much pileup has been amassed-
When secure people are driving too fast!

THREE THINGS THAT HAPPENED THAT PUT THE PUBLIC ON THE FAST TRACK (2002)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2002 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", History, Rhyme, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Poetry, Entertainment, Gold rush, Education, Summer vacation, Yellow school bus, Public, Fast track, Bankruptcy laws

1. The first set of standard bankruptcy laws
were rushed and used throughout the nation.  (1841)

2. The gold rush in California had begun.  (1848)

3. Parents all over the country at record
speed hurried their children to the bus
stop for their first day of school. (2002)

==================================================

And, to school, off they went-

After a wonderful summer vacation was spent.

Three Things That We Did Not Hear (2010)

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2010 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Cracked, Did, Drugs, Entertainment, Fall, Forest, Hear, History, Iceberg, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, NO, Not, Notion, Poetry, Rhyme, Tree, War on drugs

Three things that we did not hear:
1. That tree fall in the deep forest.
2. The iceberg that cracked.
3. The notion to say no to drugs.

============================

It was a good try-

But, illegal drug use is at a nearly ten year high.

To Change The Words To Clear-That Much Nagging Fear # 125

02 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in To Change The Words To Clear-That Much Nagging Fear Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Entertainment, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, NO, Patience, Poetry, Relax, Rhyme, Suspense, Take, Time, To Change The Words To Clear-That Much Nagging Fear, Unneeded, Unusual

I have no patience-
.
Relax, take your time, and
you will end that unneeded,
self-inflicted suspense.
-2010-

Three Possible Noises To Hear Today (2013)

02 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2013 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Boom, Burgers, Children, Entertainment, History, Hot dogs, Laughing, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Noises, Poetry, Rain, Rhyme, Sizzling, Storm, Thunder, Weather

1. Children laughing.

2. Burgers and hot dogs sizzling,  on the grill.

3. A boom, from the sky.

====================================

To the north, thunder power-

With a possible shower.

Three For Today (2013)

02 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2013 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Entertainment, Food, Heat, History, Holiday, Leisure, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Poetry, Rhyme, Unusual, Weather

1. Leisure.

2. Food.

3. Lots of water.

==

Heat still underway-

Despite it being a

holiday.

Three That We Used To Do On The Holidays (2013)

02 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times 2013 Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Celebrate, Closed, Entertainment, History, Holidays, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Open, Overeat, Poetry, Rhyme, Shut down, Unusual

1. Celebrate.

2. Overeat.

3. Close up.
===================
Nowadays, not like
back when-
Many things will be
ongoing and open.

A Child’s Time-In Simple Rhyme # 531

Once we get to the zoo-
There will be so much to do.
-2010-

To Change The Words To Clear-That Much Nagging Fear # 128

03 Sep 2013 Leave a Comment

by Mary Elizabeth in To Change The Words To Clear-That Much Nagging Fear Tags: "Three by M.E./Rhymes of the Times", Away, Bad, Disappear, Entertainment, Go, History, Mary Elizabeth Rumsey, Memories, Poetry, Rhyme, Say, Sorry, Thing, To Change The Words To Clear-That Much Nagging Fear, Unusual

I did a bad thing today-
.
All you’ve got to do is say
you’re sorry, and in our
memories, it will simply
disappear, and go away.
-2010-
